Evaluation_Questions: Your level of engagement with the course was:
What is your overall assessment of this course?
The course was well organized to facilitate student learning.
I received clear feedback that improved my learning.
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the level of <u>intellectual challenge</u> of this course was:
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the <u>workload</u> of this course was:
Comments_Questions: What knowledge, skills, and insights did you develop by taking this course?
What are the strengths and weaknesses of this course and how could it be improved?
Would you recommend this course to another student? Please explain.
Comments_List: In this course, I was able to improve my ability to speak, understand, and analyze in French. Thanks to the small seminar setting, I was able to get to know my professor and also easily ask her for assistance.
I learned a lot about the history of French literature, including the different intellectual movements. I also improved my written and spoken French and my literature analysis skills
I learned how to closely analyze French texts and got an overview of French literary history
How to analyze french writing, as well as more knowledge of 18th-19th century influential french literature and authors.
Strong literary analysis and writing skills; exposure to some of the most influential Francophone writers
I learned about the histories of various french writers/poets, and how to interpret their writing.

A weakness of this course might be the lack of structure it has since it is mainly free discussion on the pieces of literature we read. That being said, this format has also allowed students to have deep, analytical discussions.
It was a very good course.

Strengths: I enjoyed almost all of the texts we read, and the reading load is really manageable. 
Weaknesses: Class discussion had an awkward vibe, and there was not always a ton of room for speaking.
Love the way the class is set up with weekly readings and then some class reading then discussion. Assignments were evenly spaced and fairly graded.

Strengths: interesting material; engaged professor; manageable workload
Weaknesses: none
I recommend this class to students who are passionate in literature and want to improve their analytical and critical skills in French.
Yes, it is good to be exposed to literature from France in this concentrated way.
Yes, it is a great course for improving your writing and reading in French.
Yes, this class was very useful for me to brush up on my French skills as well as learn more about analyzing French literature.
Yes, the literature read is very engaging and Madame Sanjabi is an excellent teacher
Yes, I would recommend this course to anyone who wants to improve reading in french or is interested in literature
